result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jay Heit at $100/hr.  See repayment information on prior orders in 21CT397, 22CT118, and 22CT119.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

9:42 AM cases 22CF1092, 22CT118, 22CT119, 21CT397 called. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Corey D. Fouts not in court.  Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for Corey D. Fouts. Attorney Heit notes that he is not appointed to 22CF1092 and requests that they court order the appointment. Court orders that county appointment be extended to 22CF1092. State notes previous missed appearances and requests a warrant. Warrant ordered but stayed until Tuesday 10/18/2022.

10:23 cases recalled. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Corey D. Fouts in court with Attorney Jay E. Heit. Warrants are quashed.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/31/2022 at 2:30 PM
Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Case called at 11:12 AM.
Defendant Corey D. Fouts appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/3/22 at 3:30 PM.
RTN: 10/13/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
